page_analysis.text_content:
Height
&
grade

Height allowances enable a variety of architectural styles while preserving the residential scale of our neighborhoods as well as the privacy and natural light available to each lot.

Code sections
Page 46
18.12.040 (a) Table 2
Page 47
18.04.030 (64) (b)

46

Height

Structure                                Max. height
                                        to roof peak

Main dwelling on a standard lot
with a roof slope ≤12:12               30'

Main dwelling on a standard lot
with a roof slope ≥12:12               33'

Main dwelling on a substandard
or flag lot                            17'

Accessory structure in rear or
side yard                              12'

2nd-dwelling units                     17'

Fig 42 Comparison of roof slopes

33'                                    Height measured to top of roof material
30'

12 : 14    12 : 12    12 : 10    12 : 6    12 : 3

Height limit = 33'                     Height limit = 30'

Fig 43 Determining slope of roof

12"
run

6"
rise

Roof slope is the vertical rise in inches for every horizontal distance of twelve inches (called the "run"). It is expressed as rise:run or, in this example 6:12.

Note: On a drawing this slope might also be represented as:

1:2
6     or     1

2

visual_elements.description: Height specifications table showing structure types and their maximum height to roof peak. Contains 5 rows with structure descriptions and corresponding height limits.
Fig 42 - Comparison of roof slopes showing 5 house silhouettes with different roof slopes (12:14, 12:12, 12:10, 12:6, 12:3) and their corresponding height limits of either 33' or 30'
Fig 43 - Technical diagram showing how to determine roof slope with measurements of 12" run and 6" rise, illustrating the concept of rise over run calculation

Main dwelling on standard lot with roof slope ≥12:12
Main dwelling on substandard or flag lot
Accessory structure in rear or side yard

additional_notes: Page number 46 appears at bottom left
Gray sidebar on left contains introductory text and code section references
Figures 42 and 43 are referenced and labeled

qualifiers.text: on a substandard or flag lot

conditions.text: Main dwelling on a substandard or flag lot
Accessory structure in rear or side yard

logical_relationships.expression: Main dwelling on a standard lot with a roof slope ≤12:12
Main dwelling on a standard lot with a roof slope ≥12:12

execution_sequence.action: Determine if structure is main dwelling on standard lot
Measure roof slope to determine height limit
Apply appropriate height limit based on lot type and structure type
